docs.snippet: An accusation against Jameis Winston, a marquee quarterback for Florida State, did not prompt an in-depth inquiry by either the university or the police. By the time prosecutors got the case it was nearly a year old....
docs.lead_paragraph: An accusation against Jameis Winston, a marquee quarterback for Florida State, did not prompt an in-depth inquiry by either the university or the police. By the time prosecutors got the case it was nearly a year old.

headline.main: Errors in Inquiry on Rape Allegations Against FSU’s Jameis Winston

docs.snippet: At Florida State, an accusation against a star athlete prompted neither immediate action, nor an in-depth inquiry, by the university or the Tallahassee Police Department. By the time local prosecutors got the case it was nearly a year old and miss...
docs.lead_paragraph: At Florida State, an accusation against a star athlete prompted neither immediate action, nor an in-depth inquiry, by the university or the Tallahassee Police Department. By the time local prosecutors got the case it was nearly a year old and missing important evidence.
docs.abstract: Examination by The New York Times finds that there was virtually no investigation at all of allegations that Florida State University football player Jameis Winston raped a freshman in December 2012, either by the school or local authorities; case has unfolded as colleges and universities across the country are facing rising criticism over how they deal with sexual assault, as well as questions about whether athletes receive preferential treatment.

headline.main: A Top Player Accused, and a Flawed Rape Inquiry
headline.print_headline: A Top Player Accused, and a Flawed Rape Inquiry

byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett, Alain Delaquérière and Ramsey Merritt contributed research.
